guide-bienvenue-text:
WELCOME TO WILDBORNE!

Wildborne is a comprehensive modpack that transforms Vintage Story into an immersive survival experience with over 120 carefully selected mods.


INITIAL SETUP


BEFORE PLAYING, configure these essential tools:

1. AUTO MAP MARKERS
This mod automatically places markers on your map when you find ores, ruins, traders, etc.

To configure:
- Type .amm in chat to see options
- Or press Ctrl + Shift + M for the graphical menu
- Enable the markers you want (ores, ruins, traders...)
- Type .amm toggle to enable/disable

2. PROSPECT TOGETHER
This mod visually displays prospecting results on the map. Essential for finding ores!

To configure:
- Type .pt in chat to display your markers
- Type .pt toggle to enable/disable display
- Type .pt clear to clear your markers
- In multiplayer, results are shared with your team!

3. CHOOSE YOUR CLASS
The XSkills mod lets you choose a profession with bonuses:
- Press L or type .charsel
- Choose: Blacksmith, Farmer, Hunter, Miner or Artisan
- Each class has unique bonuses!


WHAT CHANGES IN WILDBORNE


1. HYDRATION IS DEADLY
The Hydrate or Diedrate mod adds a thirst gauge. Dehydration kills TWICE as fast as hunger! You must drink regularly, especially in hot weather.

2. COMBAT IS COMPLETELY REWORKED
The Combat Overhaul mod transforms combat:
- Damage is localized (head, torso, legs)
- You can parry and block
- Stamina limits your combos
- Each weapon type has its own animations

3. WILDLIFE IS ENRICHED
26 new animal families from the Fauna of the Stone Age project:
- Felines: lions, tigers, leopards, wildcats
- Canids: wolves, dogs, foxes
- Cervids: deer, elk, reindeer
- And more: elephants, rhinos, kangaroos...

4. FLORA IS DIVERSIFIED
7 floral regions inspired by the real world:
- Cape Region (South Africa)
- Caribbean Region
- Central Australian Region
- Mediterranean Region
- East Asian Region
- New Zealand Region
- Cosmopolitan Region

5. SKILLS MATTER
The XSkills system adds RPG progression:
- Every action advances a skill
- Unlock special abilities
- Item quality depends on your level


YOUR FIRST SURVIVAL PRIORITIES


PRIORITY 1: FIND WATER
This is your first emergency. Look for a river, lake, or even puddles. You can drink directly with Right Click on water, but beware of diseases!

PRIORITY 2: CRAFT TOOLS
Collect sticks and stones. Knap a knife and axe to get started.

PRIORITY 3: FIND SHELTER
Night is dangerous. Find a cave or build a simple shelter before sunset.

PRIORITY 4: EAT
Pick berries, mushrooms (watch for toxic ones!), or hunt small animals.


GUIDES IN THIS MANUAL


Check out the following guides to master Wildborne:

- Hydration - Everything about water management
- Food - Foraging, preservation, nutrition
- Hunting and Fishing - Primitive survival techniques
- Combat - Master the new combat system
- Agriculture - Farming and animal husbandry
- Cooking - From survival to feast
- Skills - RPG system and progression
- Keyboard Shortcuts - All important keys

Good luck surviving in Wildborne!
guide-hydratation-text:
HYDRATION IS YOUR TOP PRIORITY

The Hydrate or Diedrate mod adds a realistic hydration system. Dehydration kills TWICE as fast as hunger!

A new thirst gauge appears next to your hunger gauge. When it drops to zero, you start losing health rapidly.


WHERE TO FIND WATER?


NATURAL WATER (Disease risk)
- Rivers and lakes: Approach and Right Click to drink
- Puddles: Usable in emergencies
- Warning! Untreated water can make you sick

SAFE WATER
- Boiled water: Boil water in a clay pot or metal pot
- Rainwater: Place open containers outside during rain. It's free and risk-free!
- Wells: Dig down to the aquifer for a permanent source

HYDRATING DRINKS
- Soups: Hydrate and nourish
- Fruit juices: Good hydration
- Teas and infusions: Various effects depending on herbs
- Alcohol: Extended thirst pause, but side effects!


FACTORS AFFECTING THIRST


INCREASE WATER CONSUMPTION:
- Intense heat: x2 consumption in full sun
- Physical effort: Running, mining, fighting
- Warm clothing: Heavy armor makes you sweat
- Fever: If you're sick

REDUCE WATER CONSUMPTION:
- Shade: Stay out of the sun
- Night: Consumption decreases
- Rain: Being wet slows dehydration
- Cold: Less sweating


WATER STORAGE


PERSONAL TRANSPORT
- Leather waterskin: Easy to craft, limited capacity
- Clay jug: More capacity
- Metal canteen: Sturdy and practical

BASE STORAGE
- Barrels: Medium storage
- Giant tuns: Up to 950 liters!

HOW TO FILL A WATERSKIN:
1. Hold the empty waterskin
2. Aim at a water source
3. Press Shift + Right Click
4. The waterskin fills up

HOW TO DRINK FROM A WATERSKIN:
1. Hold the waterskin
2. Press Right Click


SURVIVAL TIPS


TIP 1: ALWAYS keep a filled waterskin on you
TIP 2: Establish your base near a water source
TIP 3: Place containers outside BEFORE it rains
TIP 4: Boil water as soon as you have a pot
TIP 5: While exploring, mark water points on the map
guide-nourriture-text:
FINDING FOOD TO SURVIVE

In Wildborne, food is varied thanks to many cooking mods. The Diverse Diets mod rewards you for eating varied foods!


IMMEDIATE FORAGING


From day one, you can find:

WILD BERRIES
- Berry bushes: Raspberries, blackberries, blueberries...
- Right Click to pick
- Safe to eat raw
- Regrow after a few days

MUSHROOMS
- Mushrooms in forests and caves
- WARNING! Some are toxic
- Edible mushrooms: boletus, chanterelles
- Avoid brightly colored mushrooms

EDIBLE PLANTS
- Cattails: Near water, edible roots
- Wild vegetables: Carrots, onions, leeks
- Herbs: For seasoning your dishes

FRUITS (Wildcraft Mods)
The 7 floral regions add dozens of fruits:
- Apples, pears, plums from temperate zones
- Citrus from Mediterranean zones
- Tropical fruits from hot zones


PROTEIN SOURCES


EASY TO OBTAIN
- Earthworms: Search under rocks and branches. Eat them raw for a quick protein boost!
- Eggs: In bird nests on the ground or in trees
- Grubs: In rotting wood

HUNTING AND FISHING
See the Hunting and Fishing guide for detailed techniques:
- Passive traps (snares, baskets)
- Fishing (5 different methods)
- Active hunting with weapons


FOOD PRESERVATION


Without preservation, food rots quickly!

PRESERVATION METHODS:

1. SUN DRYING
- Jerky: Cut meat into strips, let dry
- Long preservation, easy to transport
- Can be eaten as-is or cooked

2. SMOKING
- Smoker: Preserves meat and fish
- Requires wood for smoke
- Gives a delicious smoky flavor

3. COLD STORAGE
- Caves and cellars: Lower temperature
- Cellar: Slows decomposition
- Ice and snow: Optimal preservation

4. COOKING
- Cooked foods last longer
- Kills bacteria and parasites


NUTRITION AND DIVERSITY


The Diverse Diets mod rewards you for eating varied foods!

FOOD TYPES:
- Fruits: Vitamins, quick sugars
- Vegetables: Fiber, vitamins
- Meats: Proteins, long satiety
- Grains: Lasting energy
- Dairy: Calcium, proteins

DIVERSITY BONUS:
The more different foods you eat, the more health bonuses you gain!

TIP: Don't always eat the same thing. Vary between fruits, meats, vegetables and breads to maximize your bonuses.
guide-chasse-peche-text:
PRIMITIVE SURVIVAL TECHNIQUES

The Primitive Survival mod adds many realistic hunting and fishing methods. This guide explains each technique in detail.


FISHING - 5 METHODS


1. FISH BASKETS
- Fish baskets
- Crafting: Reeds + Cordage
- Use: Place in water with free space around
- Bait: Right Click with food to bait
- Harvest: Right Click when there's a catch
- Tip: Earthworms make excellent bait

2. WEIR TRAPS
- Weir traps
- Construction: Use stakes in water
- Shape: Create a closed area with a V-shaped entrance
- Activation: Right Click on the central stake to form the M
- Advantage: Can catch large fish

3. TROTLINES
- Trotlines
- Installation: Stretch cordage between two points above water
- Hooks: Attach hooks to the line
- Bait: Bait each hook individually
- Advantage: Multiple catches possible on one line

4. LIMB LINES
- Installation: Attach cordage to a tree overhanging water
- Function: Like a trotline but vertical
- Ideal for: Small streams

5. FISHING SPEAR
- Fishing spear
- Crafting: Carve a special spear
- Use: Actively hunt in shallow waters
- Technique: Aim below the fish (water refraction)
- Advantage: Active hunting, immediate results

CRAFTING HOOKS:
- Flint hook: Knap with flint
- Bone hook: Carve a bone with a knife
- Metal hooks: Cast in a mold

CRAFTING CORDAGE:
- Cordage
- Harvest cattails with a knife
- Use the fibers to make cordage
- Essential for fishing and trapping


LAND TRAPPING


1. SNARES
- Snares
- Prey: Rabbits, hares, small mammals
- Crafting: Sticks + Cordage
- Placement: On animal travel paths
- Bait: Right Click with food
- Check: Return regularly to check your traps

2. DEADFALLS
- Deadfalls
- Prey: Medium-sized animals
- Crafting: Sticks + Heavy stone
- Function: The stone crushes the animal
- Bait: ESSENTIAL to attract prey
- Reset: Right Click after triggering

3. SPIKE PITS
- Wood spikes
- Prey: Large animals, predators
- Construction:
1. Dig a deep pit
2. Place spikes at the bottom
3. Cover with branches and grass
- Danger: Be careful not to fall in yourself!

4. BED-O-NAILS
- Spike plates
- Advanced version: Metal spikes
- Crafting: Mold + Molten metal
- Damage: More effective than wood spikes
- Placement: Any surface


ACTIVE HUNTING


TRACKING PREY
The Blood Trail mod helps you:
- Wounded animals leave blood trails
- Follow the trail to find your prey
- Essential for bow hunting

BUTCHERING
The Butchering mod:
- Use a knife on dead animals
- Detailed butchering menu
- Recover: meat, hide, bones, fat, tendons...
- The more skilled you are, the more resources you recover

HUNTING WEAPONS
See the Combat guide for details on:
- Bows and arrows
- Crossbows
- Throwing spears
- Firearms (late game)
guide-combat-text:
MASTERING THE WILDBORNE COMBAT SYSTEM

The Combat Overhaul mod completely transforms Vintage Story combat. It's no longer simple click-spam, but a tactical system based on timing and strategy.


BASIC CONTROLS


ATTACK
- Left Click: Quick attack
- Hold Left Click: Charge a powerful attack
- Release at the right moment: Maximum damage

DEFENSE
- Right Click: Block / Parry
- Timing: Parry just before impact for a perfect parry
- Stamina: Blocking consumes endurance

RANGED WEAPONS
- Right Click (hold): Aim (bows, crossbows)
- Left Click: Fire
- R: Reload (crossbows, firearms)

SPEARS
- Right Click + Scroll: Change grip
- Right Click + Left Click: Throw the spear

EQUIPMENT
- G: Draw/sheathe your weapon
- Scroll Wheel: Change attack mode


LOCALIZED DAMAGE SYSTEM


Hits target specific body areas:

HEAD: Critical damage, but hard to hit
TORSO: Main zone, normal damage
ARMS: Can reduce combat effectiveness
LEGS: Can slow movement

IMPORTANT: Armor only protects covered areas!
- A helmet protects the head, not the torso
- Leg guards protect the legs, not the arms
- Equip yourself completely for total protection


ARMOR TYPES


FROM LIGHTEST TO HEAVIEST:

1. GAMBESON (Padded cloth)
- Gambeson
- Protection: Low
- Mobility: Excellent
- Ideal for: Early game, archery

2. LEATHER
- Leather armor
- Protection: Light
- Mobility: Good
- Ideal for: Exploration, hunting

3. CHAINMAIL
- Chainmail
- Protection: Medium
- Mobility: Medium
- Ideal for: General combat

4. SCALE ARMOR
- Scale armor
- Protection: Good
- Mobility: Reduced
- Ideal for: Serious combat

5. PLATE ARMOR
- Plate armor
- Protection: Maximum
- Mobility: Low
- Ideal for: Major confrontations

HISTORICAL ARMORS (Forgotten Armory):
Special armors with unique bonuses:
- Viking: Agility and cold resistance
- Templar: Perfect balance
- Hussar: Maximum speed
- Gothic: Light for its protection


WEAPON PROGRESSION


EARLY GAME (Stone/Wood)
- Flint spear: Range, can be thrown
- Simple bow: Ranged attacks
- Club: Blunt damage

BRONZE AGE
- Bronze swords: Effective melee combat
- Simple crossbow: More powerful than bow
- Shields: Improved defense

IRON AGE
- Iron swords: Increased damage
- Stirrup crossbow: Even more powerful
- Heavy armor available

STEEL AND BEYOND
- Firearms: Muskets, pistols
- Devastating damage
- Long reload time
- Requires gunpowder


COOPERATIVE COMBAT


In multiplayer, the Cooperative Combat Rework and Coop Synergy mods add:

- Flanking bonus: Surround enemies for more damage
- Role synergies: Tank + DPS + Support
- Coordinated attacks: Strike together for bonuses


COMBAT TIPS


TIP 1: NEVER attack without armor against serious enemies
TIP 2: Manage your stamina, don't spam attacks
TIP 3: Use the environment (height, obstacles)
TIP 4: Always bring bandages and food
TIP 5: Running away is sometimes the best option
guide-agriculture-text:
DEVELOPING YOUR CROPS AND LIVESTOCK

Wildborne greatly enriches agriculture with new plants, unique floral regions, and improved husbandry systems.


SOIL PREPARATION


STEP 1: TILL
- Use a hoe on the ground
- Right Click to till
- The soil becomes farmable

STEP 2: FERTILIZE
- Compost: Decompose your food scraps
- Earthworms: Place them in soil to aerate it
- Worm castings: Excellent fertilizer
- Manure: From domestic animals

STEP 3: PROTECT
- Scarecrow: Keeps pests away
- Crafting: Straw hat + Pumpkin + Mannequin
- Protection zone around the scarecrow
- Protects against: Rabbits, raccoons


WILDBORNE CROPS


BASIC CROPS
- Wheat, barley, rye, oats
- Carrots, onions, cabbage
- Sunflowers (oil)
- Flax (fibers)

WILD FRUITS (Wildcraft)
The 7 floral regions bring unique fruits:

Mediterranean Region:
- Olives, figs, pomegranates
- Citrus: lemons, oranges

East Asian Region:
- Persimmons, lychees, longans
- Tea and spices

Cape Region:
- Rooibos, honeybush
- Edible fynbos

SPECIAL CROPS
- Tobacco (Pipeleaf): For making pipes and smoking
- Aromatic herbs: For cooking
- Cultivable mushrooms


ANIMAL HUSBANDRY


ANIMAL CAPTURE
- Cages: Capture small animals with Right Click
- Transport: Use Carry On to move cages
- Release: Right Click with a full cage

TAMING (Pet AI)
Some animals can be tamed:

Dogs:
- Approach slowly
- Offer meat
- Commands: sit, follow, stay, wander

Cats:
- Attracted to fish
- Hunt pests
- Independent but affectionate

Wolves (Wolf Taming):
- Throw raw meat near them
- Progressive taming
- Large wolves can be RIDDEN!


IRRIGATION


Primitive Survival adds irrigation methods:

- Channels: Direct water to your crops
- Manual watering: With buckets or watering cans
- Water proximity: Plant near sources


AGRICULTURE SKILL


The XSkills mod improves your farming:

- Low levels: Normal yields
- Medium levels: +25% harvest
- High levels: Double yields!
- Special abilities: Accelerated growth, bonus harvests

Press K to see your progression.
guide-cuisine-text:
CULINARY EVOLUTION IN WILDBORNE

With the A Culinary Artillery and Expanded Foods mods, cooking becomes a complete art. This guide accompanies you from simple campfire to royal feast.


EQUIPMENT PROGRESSION


LEVEL 1: CAMPFIRE
- Firepit: Basic cooking
- Direct grilling over fire
- Boiling water

LEVEL 2: STONE OVEN
- Stone oven: Breads, pastries
- More stable temperature
- Even cooking

LEVEL 3: METAL POTS
- Pots: Advanced recipes
- Soups, stews, sauces
- Better cooking control

LEVEL 4: COMPLETE KITCHEN
- Cauldrons: Large quantities
- Multiple specialized utensils
- Complex recipes


CULINARY EQUIPMENT


The A Culinary Artillery mod adds:

PREPARATION
- Mixing bowls: Doughs, mixes
- Rolling pins: Roll out dough
- Cutting boards: Prepare ingredients

COOKING
- Frying pans: Sautes, frying
- Saucepans: Sauces, stews
- Cauldrons: Large quantities

PRESERVATION
- Meat hooks: Drying, aging
- Bottle racks: Beverage storage


EXPANDED FOODS RECIPES


PASTA AND STARCHES
- Fresh pasta: Spaghetti, tagliatelle, ravioli
- Various sauces: tomato, cream, pesto
- Hot and cold pasta dishes

DAIRY PRODUCTS
- Yogurts: Plain or with fruits
- Cheeses: Fresh, aged, melted
- Butter and cream

CHARCUTERIE
- Sausages: Fresh, smoked, dried
- Pemmican: Dried meat + fat, ideal for exploration
- Jerky: Long-term preservation

SWEETS
- Jams: Fruits + sugar
- Syrups: For drinks and desserts

CONDIMENTS
- Vinegar: Homemade
- Salt: Extracted from seawater
- Oils and fats


COOKING TECHNIQUES


CRACKING EGGS
- Separate yolks and whites
- Whites: meringues, mousses
- Yolks: sauces, pasta

SIMMERING
- Slow cooking over low heat
- Ideal for syrups and jams
- Concentrates flavors

PRESSING
- Extract juice from fruits
- Oil from seeds
- Base for vinaigrettes

SMOKING
- Smoker: Long-term preservation
- Unique smoky flavor
- Meats and fish


COOKING SKILL


The XSkills mod improves your cooking:

- More nutritious dishes: Satiety bonus
- Extended effects: Buffs last longer
- Superior quality: Better results

Press K to see your cooking level.
guide-competences-text:
COMPLETE XSKILLS RPG SYSTEM

The XSkills mod transforms Vintage Story into an RPG. Every action progresses you in a skill, unlocking special abilities and improving your results.


HOW IT WORKS


EXPERIENCE
- Every action gives XP in the corresponding skill
- Mining = Mining XP
- Cooking = Cooking XP
- Fighting = Combat XP

LEVELS
- XP accumulates until the next level
- Each level gives skill points
- Use points to unlock abilities

INTERFACE
- Press K to open the skills menu
- See your progress in each branch
- Select and unlock abilities


SKILL BRANCHES


MINING
- Vein extraction: Mine multiple blocks at once
- Fast excavation: Increased mining speed
- Prospecting: Better ore detection
- Resistance: Less tool wear

WOODCUTTING
- Efficient felling: Whole trees fall
- Resin harvesting: More resources
- Quality wood: Better yields

AGRICULTURE
- Increased yields: More harvests
- Accelerated growth: Plants grow faster
- Bonus seeds: More seeds per harvest

COMBAT
- Weapon mastery: Bonus per weapon type
- Swords: Quick attacks, parries
- Spears: Range, precise throws
- Bows: Accuracy, critical damage
- Maces: Heavy damage, stun

COOKING
- Nutritious dishes: Satiety bonus
- Extended effects: Longer buffs
- Secret recipes: Access to special dishes

SMITHING
- Quality tools: Increased durability
- Metal efficiency: Less waste
- Perfect tempering: Damage bonus

HUSBANDRY
- Taming: Easier and faster
- Breeding: Animals reproduce more
- Care: Heal animal injuries


ITEM QUALITY


Items you craft have variable quality:

- Poor: Durability -20%
- Normal: Base stats
- Good: Durability +10%
- Excellent: Durability +25%
- Exceptional: Durability +50%, special bonuses

The higher your skill, the more likely you are to get superior quality!


CLASSES (THE WORKING CLASSES)


Choose a profession for starting bonuses:

Press L or type .charsel

BLACKSMITH
- +20% forged tool durability
- Smithing bonus

FARMER
- +15% crop yield
- Agriculture bonus

HUNTER
- +25% damage to wild animals
- Tracking bonus

MINER
- +10% bonus ore chance
- Increased mining speed

ARTISAN
- Better quality crafts
- Versatile bonus


TRAITS (TRAIT ACQUIRER)


Your actions shape permanent traits:

POSITIVE TRAITS
- Eat varied = Iron stomach
- Fight often = Sharp reflexes
- Explore long = Increased endurance
- Mine a lot = Night vision

NEGATIVE TRAITS
Beware! Some behaviors give penalties:
- Always eating the same thing
- Fleeing from fights
- Staying still too long


XSKILLS GILDED


For veteran players:

- Gilded skills: Beyond level 100
- Ultimate abilities: Devastating powers
- Master bonuses: Permanent advantages

Ideal for long playthroughs!
guide-raccourcis-text:
ALL IMPORTANT WILDBORNE KEYS

This guide lists all keyboard shortcuts added by mods. You can modify these keys in Esc - Settings - Controls.


COMBAT (Combat Overhaul)


Left Click - Attack (hold to charge)
Right Click - Block / Parry / Aim
Right Click + Scroll - Change grip (spears)
Right Click + Left Click - Throw spear
R - Reload (crossbows, firearms)
G - Draw / Sheathe weapon
Shift + G - Draw secondary weapon
Scroll Wheel - Change attack mode
Alt + Right Click - Interact while holding weapon


SKILLS (XSkills)


K - Open skills menu
L - Open class menu
.charsel - Change class (in chat)


TRANSPORT (Carry On)


Shift + Right Click - Pick up block or entity
Right Click - Place carried object
Q - Drop carried object

Carriable objects: Chests, workbenches, beds, caged animals...


HYDRATION (Hydrate or Diedrate)


Right Click (on water) - Drink directly
Right Click (with waterskin) - Drink from waterskin
Shift + Right Click (on water) - Fill waterskin


ANIMALS (Pet AI / Wolf Taming)


Right Click (on tamed animal) - Commands menu
Shift + Right Click - Make sit / stand

Voice commands (in chat):
sit - Animal sits
follow - Animal follows you
stay - Animal stays in place
wander - Animal wanders


INFORMATION (Extra Info)


H - Toggle info display
Shift + H - Show detailed info
Shift (while aiming at plant) - See plant info


PROSPECTING (Prospect Together)


.pt - Show prospecting markers
.pt clear - Clear your markers
.pt toggle - Enable/disable display


MAP (Auto Map Markers)


.automapmarkers or .amm - Marker settings
.amm toggle - Enable/disable auto markers
Ctrl + Shift + M - Configuration menu


ALCHEMY (Alchemy)


[ - Enable/disable effects HUD
] - Move effects HUD
Ctrl + Shift + Right Click - Empty a potion vial


PIPES (Pipeleaf)


Shift + Right Click - Load tobacco into pipe
Right Click (hold 2s) - Light pipe
R - Smoke (hold for effects)
Drop in water to clean pipe


STORAGE (Sortable Storage)


Middle Click (on chest) - Sort contents
Shift + Middle Click - Sort by category


SAILING (Joy of Sailing)


W/A/S/D - Steer the boat
Shift - Accelerate
Space - Brake
E - Mount/dismount boat


ADVANCED MOVEMENT (Salty's Movement)


R - Grab a ledge (Catch Ledge)
Z - Crawl / Dive (Crawl and Dive)
V - Vault over / Roll (Vault and Roll)
Alt - Dodge (Dodge Master)
Space (at wall) - Climb (Climb Mountain)

These keys are configurable in Settings - Controls.


CANOE (Canoe Mode)


E - Mount/dismount canoe
W/A/S/D - Paddle and steer
Shift - Paddle faster
Shift + Right Click - Pick up canoe to carry

Canoes are lightweight and can be carried on land!


TOOLBELT (Toolbelt)


1-4 - Quick access to belt tools
Shift + Right Click - Equip/remove tool from belt

Craft a leather belt to always have your tools within reach!


CHISELING (Chisel Tools)


Ctrl + Z - Undo (with Pantograph)
.pf list - Show saved designs
.pf save [name] - Save a design
.pf load [name] - Load a design


BUTCHERING (Butchering)


Right Click (with knife on corpse) - Butchering menu
Sneak + Right Click - Quick butcher


SMOKE (Real Smoke)


Build a chimney above the fire to evacuate smoke.
Open doors and windows for ventilation.
WARNING: Smoke accumulates and can be dangerous!


USEFUL VANILLA KEYS


E - Inventory
C - Character inventory
B - Crafting menu
M - World map
Tab - Player list
T - Chat
/ - Command
F5 - Third person view
H - Handbook (game manual)
